Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: PLUGBACK OBSERVATION NUMBER: Plugback observation number is the codeused to uniquely identify each specific plug back interval.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: BASE DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to the base of the plugback interval.
Column Comment.5: BASE DEPTH OUOM: Base measured depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.6: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.7: CEMENT AMOUNT: Quantity of cement used to secure the plug and isolate theinterval.
Column Comment.8: CEMENT AMOUNT OUOM: Amount of cement original unit of measure.
Column Comment.9: CEMENT AMOUNT UOM: Cement amount unit of measure.
Column Comment.10: COMPLETION OBSERVATION NUMBER: A sequential observation number used touniquely identify each completed (perforated) interval.
Column Comment.11: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.12: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.13: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.14: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.15: PLUGBACK DATE: Date plug back operations were actually run to shut off lowerformations in order to permit upper formations to be produced.
Column Comment.16: PLUG TYPE: The type of operation performed to plugback the well. For example: theinstallation of a temporary plugback with a retrievable bridge plug, or the setting acement plug.
Column Comment.17: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.18: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.19: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.20: SURFACE ABANDONED DATE: Date the surface operations were abandoned onthe well site.
Column Comment.21: TOP DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to the top of the plugback interval.
Column Comment.22: TOP DEPTH OUOM: Top measured depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.23: TOP FOUND DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to where the top of thecement plug is found.
Column Comment.24: TOP FOUND DEPTH OUOM: Top found depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.25: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.26: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.27: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.28: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.29: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.30: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.31: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.32: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
